Faculty is one of Europe‚Äôs leading applied artificial intelligence companies. We build, deploy and operate AI solutions to increase our customers‚Äô performance and help them realise their full potential. We believe that AI should be trustworthy, impactful and beneficial across society. Those principles have shaped our work with more than 230 organisations across the public and private sectors as we help them use AI to understand more deeply, make better decisions and act faster.

To give an example, during the COVID-19 pandemic, we built the COVID-19 Early Warning System to forecast hospital admissions and life-saving equipment up to three weeks in advance. The ground-breaking tool helped frontline workers at the NHS save lives. We also work with the Home Office on Counter-Terrorism initiatives - Faculty built an AI model that automatically detects both new and existing propaganda videos and stops them from being uploaded.

Please note that due to the nature of our current project... requirements, applicants must either hold valid existing security clearance, or be eligible for UK security clearance (5 years continuous UK address history, no criminal convictions). Faculty will cover in full any costs associated.

What you'll be doing

The Machine Learning Engineering team is responsible for the engineering aspects of our client delivery projects. As a Senior

Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll be essential to helping us achieve that goal by:

‚Ä¢ Designing and building software and infrastructure to support Machine Learning applications;
‚Ä¢ Leading engineering interactions with our clients;
‚Ä¢ Mentoring data scientists and engineers in best practices and new technologies;
‚Ä¢ Creating reusable, scalable tools to enable better delivery of ML systems; and
‚Ä¢ Implementing and developing Faculty‚Äôs view on what it means to operationalise ML software.
‚Ä¢ You will support both technical and non-technical stakeholders to deploy ML to solve real-world problems. To enable this, we work in cross functional teams with representation from commercial and data science specialities to cover all aspects of AI product delivery.

We‚Äôre a rapidly growing organisation, so roles are dynamic and subject to change. Your role will evolve alongside business needs, but you can expect your key responsibilities to include:

‚Ä¢ Scoping projects
‚Ä¢ Providing technical support during Business Development
‚Ä¢ Managing and Mentoring technical staff
‚Ä¢ Technical Delivery

Requirements

Who We're Looking For

At Faculty, your attitude and behaviour are just as important as your technical skill. We look for individuals who can support our values, foster our culture, and deliver for our organisation.

We like people who combine expertise and ambition with optimism -- who are interested in changing the world for the better -- and have the drive and intelligence to make it happen. If you‚Äôre the right candidate for us, you probably:

‚Ä¢ Think scientifically, even if you‚Äôre not a scientist - you test assumptions, seek evidence and are always looking for opportunities to improve the way we do things.
‚Ä¢ Love finding new ways to solve old problems - when it comes to your work and your professional development, you don‚Äôt believe in ‚Äògood enough‚Äô. You always seek new ways to solve old challenges.
‚Ä¢ Are pragmatic and outcome-focused - you know how to balance the big picture with the little details and know a great idea is useless if it can‚Äôt be executed in the real world.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills;
‚Ä¢ Experience in working directly with clients and end users;
‚Ä¢ Requirements gathering;
‚Ä¢ Technical planning and scoping;
‚Ä¢ User acceptance testing;
‚Ä¢ A drive to learn new technologies and novel applications of existing technologies;
‚Ä¢ Experience in leading technical delivery; and
‚Ä¢ Technical mentoring

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll need demonstrable in the following:

‚Ä¢ Software Engineering in Python
‚Ä¢ Linux system management
‚Ä¢ Docker/Containerisation
‚Ä¢ CI/CD Technologies
‚Ä¢ Automated testing
‚Ä¢ AWS, GCP or Azure experience
‚Ä¢ Systems design and maintenance

Benefits

What we can offer you

The Faculty team is diverse and distinctive, and we all come from different personal, professional and organisational backgrounds. We all have one thing in common: we are driven by a deep intellectual curiosity that powers us forward each day. This curiosity pushes us to seek truth and understanding in everything we do, to execute work in a nimble and pragmatic manner, to foster talent in one another and always to challenge assumptions.

Faculty is the professional challenge of a lifetime. You‚Äôll be surrounded by an impressive group of brilliant minds working to advance our goal of making artificial intelligence real. Our consultants, product developers, business development specialists, operations professionals and more all bring something unique to Faculty, and you‚Äôll learn something new from everyone you meet. You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to make your mark on a high-growth start-up now poised to expand internationally.

Fostering talent is one of our core values, it‚Äôs built into our culture and what we offer. Faculty was founded by people who are passionate about continuous learning, and adding value to our people.

Some of our benefits‚Ä¶..

‚Ä¢ Genuinely flexible working: We believe people have needs, responsibilities and interests that require something different to a strict working day. We trust people to organise and take accountability for their own work and do our best to support their lives outside Faculty. We provide you with all you need to work from home, including a laptop, keyboard, chair‚Ä¶even Sony headphones!
‚Ä¢ Equity, we want you to benefit from Faculty‚Äôs growth and success.
‚Ä¢ Unlimited holidays: We encourage each other to use this time to take a break, work on personal projects, or to spend time with their friends and family.
‚Ä¢ Fantastic private health, optical and dental cover, for you & your family - including 24/7 unlimited virtual private GP appointments and covering pre-existing medical conditions.
‚Ä¢ Access to mental health coaching with Sanctus
‚Ä¢ Breakfast & Lunch daily, and more fruit, drinks and snacks than you could ever eat (for office-based employees).
‚Ä¢ We work hard and make sure we enjoy what we do. So we have frequent socials and informal get-togethers to help make sure you enjoy your time with us. You‚Äôll make friends and professional connections that will last a lifetime.

Job-Title: Director/Principal Scientist in Computational Biology, Data Science and...
Description:
Job Description

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we ‚Äúfollow the science‚Äù that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe. We identify and target steps in disease mechanisms or pathways that could be inhibited or enhanced. Our goal is to identify a compound that is effective against a disease target. Using innovative thinking, state-of-the-art facilities and robust scientific methodology we collaborate to discover the next medical breakthrough.

We have exciting plans to establish a new state-of the-art Research and Discovery Centre in London‚Äôs ‚ÄòKnowledge Quarter‚Äô opposite King‚Äôs Cross Railway station. Our new site, expected to be completed within the next 5 years, will employ circa 800 people across our research... and commercial divisions.

We are seeking highly motivated Director/Principal Scientist in Computational Biology, Data Science and Machine Learning to join growing Integrative Genomics group at our London Discovery Centre.

The successful candidate will play a leading role in identifying, developing, and deploying cutting-edge computational and machine learning methods to deliver insights in broad spectrum of diseases. They will partner across Data and Genome Science groups, and IT departments to implement foundational algorithms and leverage machine learning methods for delineating causal biology and target selection. As a project leader, they will set priorities and goals for their teams and work side-by-side with them to solve complex research problems. As a senior leader in the group, they will mentor, coach, and train group members. The successful candidate will need to communicate effectively in diverse matrix environment spanning data and genome sciences, machine learning and IT teams. They will also need to regularly update key stakeholders and senior leadership. This role is central in providing vision and continuity across a diverse group of innovative researchers who are driving the next revolution in drug discovery. The candidate will also be expected to advance their internal and external scientific profile through presentation at key internal forums, external engagements and peer-reviewed publications.

What you will do:
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement predictive modeling methods for target and biomarker discovery, and multi omics data integration
‚Ä¢ Engage with senior leaders and peers to set group strategy for machine learning adoption and implementation
‚Ä¢ Use modern AI/ML and statistical methods to drive analysis of genomics, genetics, imaging and other relevant data types across multiple therapy areas
‚Ä¢ Co-lead target discovery projects across therapy areas and functional lines
‚Ä¢ Provide technical leadership for machine learning projects across Data & Genome Sciences
‚Ä¢ Actively develops talent, fosters a high-performance culture of collaboration, engagement, self-accountability, and inclusion
‚Ä¢ Lead due diligence and evaluation of external partnerships in AI/ML
‚Ä¢ Present at key internal and external meetings, national and international conferences, publish in leading journals

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required:
‚Ä¢ PhD (with 8+ years in pharma, biotech, or academic settings; MS +12 years of experience) in Computational Biology, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or a related discipline
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated expertise in applying modern computational and AI/ML approaches to multi-omics data analysis and biological data integration
‚Ä¢ Strong hands-on skills in relevant programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
‚Ä¢ Expertise with ML and statistical approaches (e.g. Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch), collaborative software development
‚Ä¢ Experience leading teams to implement novel computational methods to solve complex research challenges
‚Ä¢ Competent working in Linux environment, cloud computing or HPC
‚Ä¢ Experience in Neuroscience, Immunology or Cardiometabolic diseases is highly desirable
‚Ä¢ Experience in modelling multi-omics clinical and functional genomics data (e.g. Bayesian Inference) in highly desirable
‚Ä¢ Experience in development and application of NLP methodologies is highly desirable
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated passion for team building, a track record of talent development
‚Ä¢ A champion for diverse and inclusive cultures

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another‚Äôs thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Who we are ‚Ä¶
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for ‚Ä¶
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us‚Äîand start making your impact today.
